text: Francesco Bordoni (1580–1654), also known as Francisque Bourdon, was an Italian sculptor who was active mainly in France. He was born in Florence and died in Paris. He was a student and son-in-law of Pietro Francesco Francavilla, and he completed a number of Francavilla's sculptures after the latter's death in 1615. ==External links== *Getty Museum Biography Category:17th-century Italian sculptors Category:Italian male sculptors Category:1580 births Category:1654 deaths
